codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTBodyStructures
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Body Structures
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all codes from [SNOMED CT](http://snomed.info/sct) where concept is-a 442083009 (Anatomical or acquired body site (body structure)).

codeSystems.name: BundleType
codeSystems.title: BundleType
codeSystems.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle - how it is intended to be used.

codeSystems.name: CommonTags
codeSystems.title: Common Tags
codeSystems.description: Common Tag Codes defined by FHIR project

codeSystems.name: CompositionAttestationMode
codeSystems.title: CompositionAttestationMode
codeSystems.description: The way in which a person authenticated a composition.

codeSystems.name: CompositionStatus
codeSystems.title: CompositionStatus
codeSystems.description: The workflow/clinical status of the composition.

codeSystems.name: DeviceUseStatementStatus
codeSystems.title: DeviceUseStatementStatus
codeSystems.description: A coded concept indicating the current status of the Device Usage.

codeSystems.name: DocumentSectionCodes
codeSystems.title: Document Section Codes
codeSystems.description: Document section codes (LOINC codes used in CCDA sections).

codeSystems.name: FHIRDocumentTypeCodes
codeSystems.title: FHIR Document Type Codes
codeSystems.description: FHIR Document Codes - all LOINC codes where scale type = 'DOC'.

codeSystems.name: DocumentClassValueSet
codeSystems.title: Document Class Value Set
codeSystems.description: This is the code specifying the high-level kind of document (e.g. Prescription, Discharge Summary, Report, etc.). Note: Class code for documents comes from LOINC, and is based upon one of the following:The type of service described by the document. It is described at a very high level in Section 7.3 of the LOINC Manual. The type study performed. It was determined by identifying modalities for study reports. The section of the chart where the document is placed. It was determined from the SETs created for Claims Attachment requests.

codeSystems.name: DocumentRelationshipType
codeSystems.title: DocumentRelationshipType
codeSystems.description: The type of relationship between documents.

codeSystems.name: HTTPVerb
codeSystems.title: HTTPVerb
codeSystems.description: HTTP verbs (in the HTTP command line). See [HTTP rfc](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) for details.

codeSystems.name: CommonLanguages
codeSystems.title: Common Languages
codeSystems.description: This value set includes common codes from BCP-47 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47)

codeSystems.name: ListEmptyReasons
codeSystems.title: List Empty Reasons
codeSystems.description: General reasons for a list to be empty. Reasons are either related to a summary list (i.e. problem or medication list) or to a workflow related list (i.e. consultation list).

codeSystems.name: ListMode
codeSystems.title: ListMode
codeSystems.description: The processing mode that applies to this list.

codeSystems.name: ListOrderCodes
codeSystems.title: List Order Codes
codeSystems.description: Base values for the order of the items in a list resource.

codeSystems.name: ResourceType
codeSystems.title: ResourceType
codeSystems.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

codeSystems.name: SearchEntryMode
codeSystems.title: SearchEntryMode
codeSystems.description: Why an entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.

codeSystems.name: All Security Labels
codeSystems.title: SecurityLabels
codeSystems.description: A single value set for all security labels defined by FHIR.

codeSystems.name: ActCode
codeSystems.title: v3 Code System ActCode
codeSystems.description:
A code specifying the particular kind of Act that the Act-instance represents within its class.  Constraints:
The kind of Act (e.g. physical examination, serum potassium, inpatient encounter, charge financial transaction, etc.) is specified with a code from one of several, typically external, coding systems.  The coding system will depend on the class of Act, such as LOINC for observations, etc. Conceptually, the Act.code must be a specialization of the Act.classCode. This is why the structure of ActClass domain should be reflected in the superstructure of the ActCode domain and then individual codes or externally referenced vocabularies subordinated under these domains that reflect the ActClass structure. Act.classCode and Act.code are not modifiers of each other but the Act.code concept should really imply the Act.classCode concept. For a negative example, it is not appropriate to use an Act.code "potassium" together with and Act.classCode for "laboratory observation" to somehow mean "potassium laboratory observation" and then use the same Act.code for "potassium" together with Act.classCode for "medication" to mean "substitution of potassium". This mutually modifying use of Act.code and Act.classCode is not permitted.

codeSystems.name: v3.ConfidentialityClassification
codeSystems.title: V3 Value SetConfidentialityClassification
codeSystems.description: Set of codes used to value Act.Confidentiality and Role.Confidentiality attribute in accordance with the definition for concept domain "Confidentiality".
